basics.name: Hunter M. Von Tungeln
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science - Data Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI
education.area: Natural Science - Information and Communication Technology
courses: ICS 111 - Introduction to Computer Science I
ICS 211 - Introduction to Computer Science II
ICS 141 - Discrete Math for Computer Science I
ICS 241 - Discrete Math for Computer Science II

highlights: Facilitate disassembly, destruction, and disposal of old hard drives
Meet with customers to expedite disposal of old/obsolete systems
Diagnose problems with old server hardware, attempt to fix and repurpose the hardware
Assist in setting up VDI terminals for customers
Facilitate delivery of VDI terminals to customers

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Information and Computer Sciences
work.summary: Assisted students for ICS 211 - Intro to Computer Science II Lab (Spring 2024)
highlights: Assisted students with coursework during instructional lab time
Created teaching material for one week of instruction
Responded to student emails regarding course content and assignments
Held office hours during an open lab session to further assist students with coursework
Create registration forms, flyers, rule sets, and find prizes for different high school competitions
Assist and collaborate with multiple parties in running the 2023 Hawaii STEM Conference

awards.title: Lockheed Martin STEM Scholarship
awards.summary: This scholarship is awarded to high school seniors with a 2.5 or above GPA, with a planned major in Computer Science and planned full-time enrollment at an accredited university. Selection is based upon academic performance, community involvement, work experience, and a statement of career and educational objectives.

awards.title: Second place & People's Choice Award
awards.summary: My team placed second overall in the high school division and won the People's Choice Award in the 2021 Hawaii Annual Code Challenge. The projects section of my portfolio web site has more details.
